meanings.definition: The act of making something rigid.
meanings.sent1: The rigidification of the metal beam was necessary for safety.
meanings.sent2: The rigidification of the clay sculpture took several hours to complete.
meanings.sent3: The rigidification of the jello in the fridge surprised everyone at the party.
meanings.sent4: The rigidification of his beliefs made it hard for him to accept new ideas.
meanings.sent5: The rigidification of the ice made it impossible to break with bare hands.

meanings.sent1: The rigidification of the tree trunk happened slowly over many years.
meanings.sent2: The rigidification of the fabric in the cold weather was noticeable.
meanings.sent3: The rigidification of the rubber band made it snap unexpectedly.
meanings.sent4: The rigidification of the traffic flow caused delays for commuters.
meanings.sent5: The rigidification of the rules made it difficult for any flexibility in the system.
